item.name: Update Available
item.description: Indicates if a firmware update is available for the monitored TeraStation.

item.name: RPSU Status
item.description: Indicates the status of the redundant power supply unit of a TeraStation, if supported by the monitored model. Returned Values: -1: Unkown 1: Fine 2: Broken

item_prototype.name: Array {#SNMPINDEX} - Capacity
item_prototype.description: The capacity of the RAID array in Gigabytes. The capacity cannot be obtained if the RAID array is not configured, not mounted, has LVM enabled, or configured as an iSCSI volume. In such cases, the value -1 will be returned by the device.

item_prototype.name: Array {#SNMPINDEX} - Status
item_prototype.description: Indicates the current RAID mode/status of an array. Returned values: -1: not supported. 1: not configured. 2: RAID 0 3: RAID 1 4: RAID 5 5: RAID 6 6: RAID 10 7: RAID 50 8: RAID 51 9: RAID 60 10: RAID 61

item_prototype.name: Array {#SNMPINDEX} - Used
item_prototype.description: Indicates what percentage of the RAID array capacity has been used. The array usage cannot be obtained if the RAID array is not configured, not mounted, has LVM enabled, or configured as an iSCSI volume. In such cases, the value -1 will be returned by the device.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX} - Capacity
item_prototype.description: The capacity of the disk in Gigabytes. The capacity cannot be obtained if the disk is not mounted, has LVM enabled, or is configured as an iSCSI volume. In such cases, the value -1 will be returned by the device.

item_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX} - S.M.A.R.T. Current Pending Sector Count
Disk {#SNMPINDEX} - S.M.A.R.T. Offline Uncorrectable Sector Count
Disk {#SNMPINDEX} - S.M.A.R.T. Status
item_prototype.description: S.M.A.R.T. overall health self-assessment test results.

valuemap.name: Buffalo TeraStation NAS Disk S.M.A.R.T. Status

item_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX} - Status
item_prototype.description: The current state of a NAS drive. Returned values: -1: Unknown 1: Normal 2: Member of Array 1 3: Member of Array 2 4: Hot Spare / Normal 5: Removed from Array 6: Dismounted / Plugged 7: Hot Spare / Dismounted 8: Failed 9: Unplugged 10: Member of Array 3 11: Member of Array 4 12: Media Cartridge 13: Member of Array 5 14: Member of Array 6

item_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX} - Used
item_prototype.description: Indicates what percentage of the disk capacity has been used. The disk usage cannot be obtained if the disk is not mounted, has LVM enabled, or is configured as an iSCSI volume. In such cases, the value -1 will be returned by the device.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Buffalo TeraStation - SNMP v2c:Disk.Smart.Status.[{#SNMPINDEX}].nodata(1m)}<>1 and {Template Buffalo TeraStation - SNMP v2c:Disk.Smart.Status.[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2
trigger_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX} - S.M.A.R.T. Status

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Buffalo TeraStation - SNMP v2c:Disk.Smart.Status.[{#SNMPINDEX}].nodata(1m)}<>1 and {Template Buffalo TeraStation - SNMP v2c:Disk.Smart.Status.[{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=3
trigger_prototype.name: Disk {#SNMPINDEX} - S.M.A.R.T. Status

item_prototype.name: TeraStation Error
item_prototype.description: Codes indicating that an error occurred. See the manual for the model of your NAS for more information about error codes.

item_prototype.name: TeraStation Info
item_prototype.description: Codes representing warnings or status messages. See the manual for the model of your NAS for more information about status codes.

item_prototype.name: iSCSI Volume {#SNMPINDEX} - Status
item_prototype.description: The connection status of an iSCSI volume. Returned values: -1: Unkown 1: Connected 2: Standing By

item_prototype.name: Logical Volume {#SNMPINDEX} - Capacity
item_prototype.description: Indicates the capacity of a logical volume. The capacity cannot be obtained if the logical volume is configured as an iSCSI volume. In that case, the value -1 will be returned by the device.

item_prototype.name: Logical Volume {#SNMPINDEX} - Used
item_prototype.description: Indicates what percentage of a logical volume has been used. The usage cannot be obtained if the logical volume is configured as an iSCSI volume. In that case, the value -1 will be returned by the device.

trigger_prototype.name: NAS Logical Volume {#SNMPVALUE} - More than 90% Used

trigger.expression: {Template Buffalo TeraStation - SNMP v2c:Firmware.Availability.nodata(1m)}<>1 and {Template Buffalo TeraStation - SNMP v2c:Firmware.Availability.last()}=1
trigger.name: Firmware Update Available
Used 95% of memory for the last 10 minutes

value_map.name: Buffalo TeraStation NAS Disk S.M.A.R.T. Status
